meanings.definition: Consisting of more than one cell
meanings.sent1: The human body is made up of multicellular organisms.
meanings.sent2: Plants are multicellular, meaning they have many cells working together.
meanings.sent3: The multicellular creatures in the pond had a party to celebrate their unity.
meanings.sent4: The city was like a multicellular organism, with different departments acting as its cells.
meanings.sent5: The concept of multicellular life forms fascinated the young biologist.

meanings.definition: Having or consisting of multiple cells
meanings.sent1: A sponge is an example of a multicellular organism.
meanings.sent2: The human body is multicellular, with various types of cells performing different functions.
meanings.sent3: The multicellular cake had layers of deliciousness waiting to be devoured.
meanings.sent4: The multicellular structure of the building allowed for efficient communication between departments.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted a vibrant world of multicellular organisms.
